= asctime =

== Description ==
Converts a Unix timestamp (seconds since epoch) into a human-readable ASCII date and time string.

== Syntax ==
 asctime(timestamp)

== Parameters ==
; timestamp : integer
: The Unix timestamp to convert, representing seconds since January 1, 1970 (epoch).

== Return Value ==
: string
: A formatted date and time string in the format "Mon Nov 18 18:49:08 1996"

== Examples ==
 dilbegin time_example();
 var
  current_time : integer;
  time_string : string;
 code
 {
  :start:
  current_time := realtime;
  time_string := asctime(current_time);
  sendtext("Current time: " + time_string + "<br/>", activator);
 } dilend

 dilbegin birth_info();
 var
  pc : unitptr;
  birth_time : string;
 code
 {
  :start:
  wait(SFB_CMD, command("birth") and (activator.type == UNIT_ST_PC));
  pc := activator;
  birth_time := asctime(pc.birth);
  sendtext("Your character was created " + birth_time + ".<br/>", pc);
 } dilend

 dilbegin log_timestamp();
 var
  log_entry : string;
 code
 {
  :start:
  log_entry := "System check at " + asctime(realtime);
  log(log_entry);
 } dilend

== Notes ==
* The function uses the standard C library ctime() function internally
* The returned string format is always: "Day Month Date HH:MM:SS Year"
* Commonly used with realtime() to get current time
* Useful for logging, displaying creation times, or timestamping events
* The input parameter must be an integer representing Unix timestamp

== See Also ==
* realtime - For getting the current Unix timestamp
* log - For logging timestamped messages
* mud - For game-specific time functions
